curam.util.resources

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.resources.StringUtil

  • public final class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    StringUtil provides various convenience methods for string manipulation that are not provided by the JDK.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • rtrim

        public static java.lang.String rtrim(java.lang.String text)
        Trim trailing white space from string. The text is truncated so as to drop any trailing characters less than ' '.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to trim
        Returns:
        The trimmed string

      • rtrimSpacesOnly

        public static java.lang.String rtrimSpacesOnly(java.lang.String text)
        Trim trailing white space from string. The text is truncated so as to drop any trailing spaces.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to trim
        Returns:
        The trimmed string

      • delimitedText2StringList

        public static StringList delimitedText2StringList(java.lang.String text,
                                                  char delimiter)
        Convert a string which is delimited by a specified character into a StringList. An input string with no delimiters is considered to contain one delimited field equal to the whole input string. An input string ending with a delimiter is considered to have an empty final field. Thus, for example, an input string consisting of a single delimiter will result in the output of two empty fields.
        Parameters:
        text - The delimited string
        delimiter - The character which represents the delimiter
        Returns:
        A new StringList

      • delimitedText2StringListWithTrim

        public static StringList delimitedText2StringListWithTrim(java.lang.String text,
                                                          char delimiter)
        Convert a string which is delimited by a specified character into a StringList and trim leading and trailing white spaces from the result. An input string with no delimiters is considered to contain one delimited field equal to the whole input string. An input string ending with a delimiter is considered to have an empty final field. Thus, for example, an input string consisting of a single delimiter will result in the output of two empty fields.
        Parameters:
        text - The delimited string
        delimiter - The character which represents the delimiter
        Returns:
        A new StringList
        See Also:
        StringUtil.delimitedText2StringList(String, char)

      • tabText2StringList

        public static StringList tabText2StringList(java.lang.String tabText)
        Convert a tab-delimited string into a StringList. The StringList contains one entry for each tab delimited field in the input string. An input string with no tabs is considered to contain one tab-delimited field equal to the whole input string. An input string ending with a tab character is considered to have an empty final field. Thus, for example, an input string consisting of a single tab character will result in the output of two empty fields.
        Parameters:
        tabText - A tab-delimited string
        Returns:
        A new StringList

      • tabText2StringListWithTrim

        public static StringList tabText2StringListWithTrim(java.lang.String tabText)
        Convert a tab-delimited string into a StringList and trim leading and trailing white spaces from the result. The StringList contains one entry for each tab delimited field in the input string. An input string with no tabs is considered to contain one tab-delimited field equal to the whole input string. An input string ending with a tab character is considered to have an empty final field. Thus, for example, an input string consisting of a single tab character will result in the output of two empty fields.
        Parameters:
        tabText - A tab-delimited string
        Returns:
        A new StringList
        See Also:
        StringUtil.tabText2StringList(String)

      • newlineText2StringList

        public static StringList newlineText2StringList(java.lang.String text)
        Convert a new line delimited string into a StringList. The StringList contains one entry for each newline delimited field in the input string. An input string with no newlines is considered to contain one newline delimited field equal to the whole input string. An input string ending with a newline character is considered to have an empty final field. Thus, for example, an input string consisting of a single newline character will result in the output of two empty fields.
        Parameters:
        text - A newline-delimited string
        Returns:
        A new StringList

      • escapeString

        public static java.lang.String escapeString(java.lang.String string)
        Escapes the characters within a string. The following characters are treated as special case characters:
        • newline
        • tab
        • backspace
        • carriage return
        • form feed
        • double quote
        • backslash
        and they are pre-pended with an escape character in the new string.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be parsed
        Returns:
        The string with any special characters escaped

      • unEscapeString

        public static java.lang.String unEscapeString(java.lang.String string)
        Reverses the task performed by escape String.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be parsed
        Returns:
        The string with any special characters escaped
        See Also:
        StringUtil.escapeString(String)

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String text,
                                       java.lang.String pattern,
                                       java.lang.String replace)
        This method finds all matches to a string pattern and replaces them with another string pattern.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to have replacements made to it.
        pattern - The pattern to replace.
        replace - The replacement string.
        Returns:
        The replaced string.

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String text,
                                       int start,
                                       int end,
                                       java.lang.String replace)
        This method replaces the substring between the specified positions them with another string.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to have replacements made to it.
        start - The start position of replacement.
        end - The end position of replacement (not included).
        replace - The replacement string.
        Returns:
        The replaced string.

      • replaceAtIndex

        public static java.lang.String replaceAtIndex(java.lang.String text,
                                              java.lang.String pattern,
                                              java.lang.String replace,
                                              int index)
        This method replaces a piece of text at a given index with a specified pattern.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to have replacements made to it.
        pattern - The pattern to replace.
        replace - The replacement string.
        index - The index make the pattern replacement.
        Returns:
        The replaced string.

      • isNullOrEmpty

        public static boolean isNullOrEmpty(java.lang.String theString)
        Returns true if the given string is null or is an empty string. This method does not trim the string before testing it for emptiness.
        Parameters:
        theString - The string to be tested.
        Returns:
        True if the given string is null or is an empty string.

      • stripQualifiersFromClassName

        public static java.lang.String stripQualifiersFromClassName(java.lang.String qualifiedClassName)
                                                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Given a fully-qualified class name, returns the last part of that name (i.e. the name of the class, minus the package qualifiers). This method does not attempt to determine the validity of the class name. Passing in a null string will result in the usual NullPointerException.
        Parameters:
        qualifiedClassName - The fully-qualified name of a class.
        Returns:
        The name of the class, minus the package qualifiers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if qualifiedClassName is null.

      • unquote

        public static java.lang.String unquote(java.lang.String quotedString,
                                       char quoteCharLeft,
                                       char quoteCharRight)
        Remove specified quotes from the string only if it surrounded by symbols specified by quoteCharLeft and quoteCharRight.
        Parameters:
        quotedString - The string to be processed
        quoteCharLeft - The quote character to be removed from the left
        quoteCharRight - The quote character to be removed from the right
        Returns:
        The string with quotes removed from the left and right

      • unquote

        public static java.lang.String unquote(java.lang.String quotedString)
        Remove double quotes from the string only if it correctly quoted. Return the input string intact if the input string was not quoted.
        Parameters:
        quotedString - The string to be processed
        Returns:
        The string with double quotes removed from left and right side of the input string

      • getContextName

        public static javax.naming.Name getContextName(java.lang.String lookupString)
                                        throws javax.naming.InvalidNameException
        Creates the Context Name from the String provided. No File separator is passed when creating the Name to allow for a flat direction lookup.
        Parameters:
        lookupString - The string to be processed
        Returns:
        The name valid for the platform that is being run upon
        Throws:
        javax.naming.InvalidNameException - if the lookupString is invalid

      • stripAngularBrackets

        public static java.lang.String stripAngularBrackets(java.lang.String expression)
        Strips the angular brackets out of a data item expression.
        Parameters:
        expression - The expression to strip of enclosing brackets.
        Returns:
        The stripped expression.

      • formatPath

        public static java.lang.String formatPath(java.lang.String path)
        This method formats file paths that are in string format to the format for the operating system. All forward and backward slashes are replaced with the operating system file separator. If the path ends in a slash (either forward or backward) then it is removed so all paths returned by this method are consistent. If null is passed to this method, then null is returned
        Parameters:
        path - The file path to be formatted
        Returns:
        The file path formatted with the operating system file separators.
